unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Finding the P-value of a 1-sided When Given a 2-sided P-value
question_text: A two-sided hypothesis test obtained a $p$ -value of $0.36$ . If the test was conducted as a one-tailed test using the same set of data, which of the following is true about the possible $p$ -values that could have been acquired?

choices.text: The only possible p p - value is 0.18 0.18 .
The only possible p p - value is 0.72 0.72 .
The only possible p p - value is 0.82 0.82 .
The possible p p - values are 0.18 0.18 and 0.72 0.72 .
The  possible p p - values  are 0.18 0.18 and 0.82 0.82 .
